subject: Re: [junit] How to run individual test case within a test class from 	command line(JUnit 4.x)
msgSnippet: Way after the fact, but this should work, as of JUnit 4.6.  Let us know if it doesn t. David Saff
messageBody:
Way after the fact, but this should work, as of JUnit 4.6. Let us
know if it doesn't.

David Saff

On Mon, Oct 20, 2008 at 12:06 PM, Ryan Huff <rhuff@...> wrote:
> Ok, well I was trying to do this with my JUnit 3 style test cases, (as you
> can see from the fact that the method is "testAdd"), and when I try this
> with my JUnit 4 test cases it works.
>
> So it looks like it just doesn't work for JUnit 3 tests? That's kinda
> disappointing if it's the case...because I can run an entire class full of
> JUnit 3 style tests with the JUnitCore fa√ßade, but I can't run individual
> methods with it. :(
>
> From: Ryan Huff
> Sent: Monday, October 20, 2008 11:44 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: RE: [junit] How to run individual test case within a test class
> from command line(JUnit 4.x)
>
> Hey David,
>
> Thanks for the reply. I am trying what you suggest, and it appears to be
> working...but not working as intended. It is still running all of the tests.
>
> I am doing:
>
> Result r = (new
> JUnitCore()).run(Request.method(Class.forName("my.package.CalculatorTest"),
> "testAdd"));
>
> And it's acting like I'm just doing:
>
> Result r = (new
> JUnitCore()).run(Class.forName("my.package.CalculatorTest"));
>
> in that it's still running every test in my.package.CalculatorTest. From
> what you said and what I've read in the javadoc, this should be
> working...but either I'm doing something wrong or it's not working. Can
> anyone confirm that using run(Request) actually works? Thanks again.
>
> BTW, I'm using JUnit 4.5
>
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of
> David Saff
> Sent: Thursday, October 16, 2008 10:38 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com
> Subject: Re: [junit] How to run individual test case within a test class
> from command line(JUnit 4.x)
>
> nom_ah,
>
> This should work (I haven't compiled it):
>
> new JUnitCore.run(Request.method(class, methodName));
>
> Let me know.
>
> David Saff
>
> On Wed, Oct 15, 2008 at 1:44 PM, nom_ah
> <rhuff@...<mailto:rhuff%40slickedit.com>> wrote:
>> I am wondering if it is possible to run an individual test case from a
>> test class from the command line using JUnitCore? I have searched
>> high and low to find an answer to this question, and unfortunately the
>> only information I have been able to obtain is how to run an
>> individual test from within the Eclipse GUI (or by using the @Ignore
>> annotation and recompiling source).
>>
>> Is this possible? If so, how? If not, is it possible by using
>> something other than JUnitCore? Just to be super clear, say I have a
>> test class CalculatorTest with several test methods. I want to be
>> able to run CalculatorTest.multiply, not just all of the methods in
>> CalculatorTest.
>>
>> Thanks in advance.
>>
>>
>
